A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Upon reflection\, I am not happy with this movie\, or the franchise as it stands. Which\, given my emotional and financial investment over the years\, actually does make me sad. As a life long fan of the entire Star Wars universe\, including some amazing games and books (which were largely\, and unceremoniously tossed out of the cannon by Disney) 2 things: 1) most importantly\, I agree with Mark Hamill - Disney has totally\, and shamefully ruined Luke's character (and he's always been my favorite in the mythology)\, and 2) certain aspects of the ending/overall story were VERY poorly handled. In my opinion\, it was enough to take the movie from being potentially great to being a visually stunning\, but weak-storied movie with very serious flaws. At this point I'd prefer to think of Star Wars pre-Disney\, when it was carefully and lovingly tended to by its creator\, George Lucas. Now it's just a directionless hot mess being desperately tossed from director to director in an attempt to formulate something cohesive. It's not working.
